speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: SCENE III. Plain between the camps.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: KING HENRY enters with his power. Alarum to the battle. Then enter DOUGLAS and SIR WALTER BLUNT

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: What is thy name, that in the battle thus

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: Thou crossest me? what honour dost thou seek

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: Upon my head?

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Know then, my name is Douglas;

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: And I do haunt thee in the battle thus

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Because some tell me that thou art a king.

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: They tell thee true.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: The Lord of Stafford dear to-day hath bought

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Thy likeness, for instead of thee, King Harry,

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: This sword hath ended him: so shall it thee,

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Unless thou yield thee as my prisoner.

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: I was not born a yielder, thou proud Scot;

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: And thou shalt find a king that will revenge

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: Lord Stafford's death.

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: They fight. DOUGLAS kills SIR WALTER BLUNT. Enter HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: O Douglas, hadst thou fought at Holmedon thus,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: never had triumph'd upon a Scot.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: All's done, all's won; here breathless lies the king.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Where?

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Here.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: This, Douglas? no: I know this face full well:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A gallant knight he was, his name was Blunt;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Semblably furnish'd like the king himself.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: A fool go with thy soul, whither it goes!

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: A borrow'd title hast thou bought too dear:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Why didst thou tell me that thou wert a king?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The king hath many marching in his coats.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Now, by my sword, I will kill all his coats;

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: I'll murder all his wardrobe, piece by piece,

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Until I meet the king.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Up, and away!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Our soldiers stand full fairly for the day.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Alarum. Enter FALSTAFF, solus

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Though I could 'scape shot-free at London, I fear

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the shot here; here's no scoring but upon the pate.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Soft! who are you? Sir Walter Blunt: there's honour

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: for you! here's no vanity! I am as hot as moulten

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lead, and as heavy too: God keep lead out of me! I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: need no more weight than mine own bowels. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: led my ragamuffins where they are peppered: there's

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not three of my hundred and fifty left alive; and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: they are for the town's end, to beg during life.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: But who comes here?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, stand'st thou idle here? lend me thy sword:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Many a nobleman lies stark and stiff

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Under the hoofs of vaunting enemies,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Whose deaths are yet unrevenged: I prithee,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: lend me thy sword.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O Hal, I prithee, give me leave to breathe awhile.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Turk Gregory never did such deeds in arms as I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: done this day. I have paid Percy, I have made him sure.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He is, indeed; and living to kill thee. I prithee,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: lend me thy sword.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Nay, before God, Hal, if Percy be alive, thou get'st

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not my sword; but take my pistol, if thou wilt.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Give it to me: what, is it in the case?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ay, Hal; 'tis hot, 'tis hot; there's that will sack a city.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: PRINCE HENRY draws it out, and finds it to be a bottle of sack

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, is it a time to jest and dally now?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He throws the bottle at him. Exit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, if Percy be alive, I'll pierce him. If he do

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: come in my way, so: if he do not, if I come in his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: willingly, let him make a carbonado of me. I like

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not such grinning honour as Sir Walter hath: give me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: life: which if I can save, so; if not, honour comes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: unlooked for, and there's an end.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit FALSTAFF
